description: AI knowledge base for managing subscriber relationships, pricing strategies, retention, and subscription analytics

qa_pairs.question: How do I set my subscription price?
question_variations: What should I charge for my subscription?
How much should my subscription cost?
How do I change my subscription price?
qa_pairs.answer:
**How to Set Your Subscription Price:**

**Navigate to Settings:**
1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Subscriptions**
2. Click **Edit Pricing**

**Recommended Pricing:**

**Beginner (New Creator):**
- $4.99 - $7.99/month
- Build your audience first
- Prove consistent content delivery

**Established (100+ posts):**
- $9.99 - $14.99/month
- Regular posting schedule
- High-quality content

**Premium (Professional):**
- $19.99 - $29.99/month
- Daily exclusive content
- Direct interaction with fans
- Professional production quality

**Consider These Factors:**

‚úÖ **Content Quality** - Professional = higher price
‚úÖ **Posting Frequency** - Daily posts support higher prices
‚úÖ **Engagement Level** - Personal interaction adds value
‚úÖ **Niche Demand** - Specialized content can charge more
‚úÖ **Competition** - Research similar creators in your niche

**Revenue Split:**
- You earn: **80%** of subscription revenue
- Platform: 20%

**Pro Tip:** Start lower ($4.99-$7.99) to build subscribers, then gradually increase as you add value and prove consistency.

qa_pairs.question: How much money can I make from subscriptions?
question_variations: What can I earn from subscribers?
How much do creators make from subscriptions?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Subscription Revenue Examples:**

**Beginner Creator:**
- 50 subscribers √ó $7.99/month = $399.50/month
- Your 80% share: **$319.60/month** ($3,835/year)

**Established Creator:**
- 200 subscribers √ó $12.99/month = $2,598/month
- Your 80% share: **$2,078.40/month** ($24,941/year)

**Professional Creator:**
- 500 subscribers √ó $19.99/month = $9,995/month
- Your 80% share: **$7,996/month** ($95,952/year)

**Premium Creator:**
- 1,000 subscribers √ó $24.99/month = $24,990/month
- Your 80% share: **$19,992/month** ($239,904/year)

**Revenue Split Breakdown:**
- You earn: **80%** of all subscription fees
- Platform: 20% (covers payment processing, hosting, support)

**Additional Income Streams:**
- Tips during streams: 80% of tips
- PPV content: 80% of unlock fees
- Paid messages: 80% of message fees
- Private streams: 100% of stream fee

**Payment Schedule:**
- Earnings from 1st-15th ‚Üí Paid on the 15th
- Earnings from 16th-end ‚Üí Paid on last day of month

**Pro Tip:** Subscriptions provide **predictable recurring revenue**. Combine with PPV content and tips to maximize earnings. Many creators earn 3-5x their subscription revenue from additional sales to subscribers.

qa_pairs.question: How do I reduce subscriber churn?
question_variations: How to keep subscribers from canceling?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Proven Retention Strategies:**

**1. Consistent Posting Schedule ‚≠ê (Most Important)**
- Post at the same times each week
- Set subscriber expectations
- Use the post scheduler to maintain consistency
- Minimum: 3-5 posts per week

**2. Exclusive Subscriber Content**
- Give subscribers something they can't get elsewhere
- Behind-the-scenes content
- Personal messages and updates
- Early access to new content
- Subscriber-only polls and Q&A

**3. Direct Engagement**
- Respond to subscriber messages within 24 hours
- Send personalized welcome messages to new subscribers
- Monthly "Thank You" messages to long-term subscribers
- Use mass messaging for special announcements

**4. Value-Added Perks**
- Subscriber shoutouts in posts
- Discounts on PPV content (10-20% off)
- Free access to occasional private streams
- Exclusive merchandise or giveaways

**5. Monitor Your Analytics**
- Check **Subscriber Analytics** weekly
- Identify cancellation patterns (which days/weeks)
- Survey canceled subscribers ("Why did you leave?")
- Adjust content based on what performs best

**6. Re-Engagement Campaigns**
- Send re-subscribe offers to canceled subscribers
- Limited-time discounts (e.g., "Come back for $5.99")
- Highlight new content since they left

**7. Avoid These Churn Triggers:**
- ‚ùå Irregular posting (biggest cause of churn)
- ‚ùå Too much PPV content (frustrates subscribers)
- ‚ùå Low engagement with fans
- ‚ùå Recycled free content
- ‚ùå Price increases without added value

**Industry Benchmarks:**
- Good retention: 85%+ subscribers stay monthly
- Average retention: 70-80%
- Poor retention: Below 70%

**Check Your Retention:**
Go to **Dashboard** ‚Üí **Subscribers** ‚Üí **Retention Rate**

**Pro Tip:** The first 30 days are critical. Engage heavily with new subscribers during their first month to build loyalty.

qa_pairs.question: How do free trials work?
question_variations: How to do a free trial period?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Free Trial Setup:**

**Navigate to Trial Settings:**
1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Subscriptions**
2. Click **Promotions** tab
3. Click **Create Free Trial**

**Trial Options:**

**7-Day Free Trial**
- Best for new creators building audience
- Fans can explore your content risk-free
- Converts to paid after 7 days

**14-Day Free Trial**
- Good for established creators
- More time for fans to see your value
- Higher conversion rate than 7-day

**30-Day Free Trial**
- Premium strategy for high-value content
- Builds strong habit before payment
- Use for special promotions

**How It Works:**

1. **Fan Subscribes** - Enters payment info but isn't charged
2. **Free Access** - Gets full subscriber access during trial
3. **Reminder Sent** - 2 days before trial ends, we email them
4. **Auto-Convert** - Trial converts to paid subscription automatically
5. **Fan Can Cancel** - Can cancel anytime during trial (no charge)

**What Fans Get During Trial:**
- ‚úÖ All subscriber posts
- ‚úÖ Ability to send messages
- ‚úÖ Access to subscriber-only streams
- ‚ùå No PPV content (unless purchased separately)

**Best Practices:**

**For New Creators:**
- Offer 7-14 day trials to build initial subscriber base
- Post frequently during trial period
- Send welcome message to trial subscribers

**For Established Creators:**
- Use trials as limited-time promotions
- "48-hour flash sale: 7-day free trial!"
- Combine with major content releases

**Tracking Trial Performance:**
Go to **Dashboard** ‚Üí **Subscribers** ‚Üí **Trial Conversions**

- See trial‚Üípaid conversion rate
- Average: 60-70% convert to paid
- Good: 75%+ conversion

**Pro Tip:** During a trial period, post your best content and engage heavily. The trial is your chance to prove your value and convert them to paying subscribers.

qa_pairs.question: Can I offer different subscription tiers?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Yes! You can offer up to 3 subscription tiers.**

**Setting Up Tiers:**
1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Subscriptions**
2. Click **Subscription Tiers**
3. Click **Add Tier**

**Common Tier Structures:**

**Basic Tier ($9.99/month):**
- Access to all subscriber posts
- Can send messages
- View subscriber-only streams

**VIP Tier ($19.99/month):**
- Everything in Basic
- 20% discount on PPV content
- Priority message responses
- Weekly personalized video message
- Early access to new content

**Premium Tier ($39.99/month):**
- Everything in VIP
- Monthly 1-on-1 video call (15 min)
- Custom content request per month
- Exclusive behind-the-scenes content
- Name in credits/shoutouts

**Alternative Structure (Bronze/Silver/Gold):**

**Bronze ($7.99):** Standard access
**Silver ($14.99):** + PPV discounts, priority responses
**Gold ($29.99):** + Monthly custom content, video calls

**Benefits of Tiers:**

‚úÖ **Higher Revenue** - Superfans pay more for premium access
‚úÖ **Flexible Pricing** - Fans choose their budget
‚úÖ **Reward Loyalty** - VIP treatment for top supporters
‚úÖ **Upsell Opportunity** - Convert Basic ‚Üí VIP subscribers

**Managing Tiers:**

**Tier Badges:**
- Subscribers get badges next to their name (ü•âü•àü•á)
- Shows their tier in messages and comments

**Tier-Exclusive Content:**
- When uploading content, select which tiers can see it
- VIP/Premium can get exclusive posts

**Tier Analytics:**
Go to **Dashboard** ‚Üí **Subscribers** ‚Üí **By Tier**

- See subscriber count per tier
- Revenue breakdown by tier
- Upgrade/downgrade trends

**Best Practices:**

1. **Start Simple** - Offer 2 tiers initially (Basic + VIP)
2. **Clear Value** - Make higher tier benefits obvious
3. **Deliver Consistently** - Honor all tier promises
4. **Promote Upgrades** - Remind Basic subscribers of VIP perks
5. **Limit Top Tier** - Consider capping Premium at 50-100 spots (creates exclusivity)

**Pro Tip:** 20-30% of subscribers typically upgrade to higher tiers if the value is clear. Focus on over-delivering to your VIP/Premium subscribers to justify the higher price.

qa_pairs.question: How do I see my subscriber analytics?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Access Subscriber Analytics:**

Go to **Dashboard** ‚Üí **Subscribers**

**Key Metrics Available:**

**1. Subscriber Overview**
- **Total Subscribers** - Current active count
- **New This Month** - Growth rate
- **Canceled This Month** - Churn rate
- **Net Growth** - New minus canceled
- **Retention Rate** - % who renew monthly

**2. Revenue Analytics**
- **Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR)** - Predictable income
- **Average Revenue Per User (ARPU)** - Per-subscriber value
- **Projected Annual Revenue** - MRR √ó 12
- **Revenue by Tier** - Which tier earns most

**3. Growth Trends (Charts)**
- Subscriber count over time (last 90 days)
- New vs. canceled subscribers
- Revenue trends
- Retention rate trends

**4. Subscriber Demographics**
- Top countries (where subscribers are from)
- Subscription duration (how long they've been subscribed)
- Tier distribution (Basic vs. VIP vs. Premium)
- Renewal dates (when subscriptions renew)

**5. Engagement Metrics**
- Message response rate
- Content view rate (% of subscribers viewing posts)
- Most popular content
- Peak activity times

**6. Churn Analysis**
- Cancellation reasons (if provided)
- Average subscription length before canceling
- Which content correlates with cancellations
- Seasonal patterns

**7. Trial Performance**
- Trial sign-ups
- Trial ‚Üí paid conversion rate
- Average days to convert

**Advanced Reports:**

**Cohort Analysis:**
Go to **Dashboard** ‚Üí **Subscribers** ‚Üí **Cohorts**
- See retention by signup month
- Compare different subscriber groups

**Export Data:**
- Click **Export** button in any report
- Download CSV for Excel analysis
- Available formats: CSV, PDF, Excel

**Best Practices:**

‚úÖ **Check Weekly** - Review subscriber metrics every Monday
‚úÖ **Watch Trends** - Look for patterns, not just numbers
‚úÖ **Act on Insights** - Adjust strategy based on data
‚úÖ **Compare Months** - Track growth month-over-month

**Pro Tip:** Set up **Custom Alerts** in Settings ‚Üí Notifications. Get notified when:
- Retention drops below X%
- You hit subscriber milestones (100, 500, 1000)
- Cancellations spike
- Revenue goals are met

qa_pairs.question: What happens when a subscriber cancels?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Subscription Cancellation Process:**

**When a Subscriber Cancels:**

1. **They Keep Access** - Until current billing period ends
   - If they subscribed on the 5th and cancel on the 12th
   - They keep access until the next 5th
   - They paid for the full month, so they get it

2. **No Refunds** - Cancellation is effective at period end
   - They aren't charged for the next period
   - Current period is non-refundable

3. **You're Notified**
   - Email notification: "[Fan Name] canceled their subscription"
   - Shows in Dashboard ‚Üí Subscribers ‚Üí Canceled

4. **Access Ends**
   - On their next billing date, access terminates
   - They can no longer view subscriber posts
   - Can still send messages (but you can disable this)

5. **Resubscribe Option**
   - They can resubscribe anytime
   - At current subscription price (not old price if you raised it)

**What You Should Do:**

**Immediate Actions:**
- ‚úÖ Send a farewell message (automated option available)
- ‚úÖ Ask for feedback: "Why did you cancel?"
- ‚úÖ Offer incentive: "Come back for 20% off next month"

**Don't Do:**
- ‚ùå Remove their access early
- ‚ùå Send angry/guilt messages
- ‚ùå Spam them with re-subscribe offers

**Cancellation Settings:**

Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Subscriptions** ‚Üí **Cancellation**

**Configure:**
- Auto-send farewell message (optional)
- Request cancellation reason (helps improve)
- Offer re-subscribe discount code
- Whether canceled subs can still message you

**Win-Back Campaigns:**

**30 Days After Cancellation:**
- Send re-subscribe offer
- Highlight new content since they left
- Limited-time discount (e.g., "$5.99 for first month back")

**90 Days After Cancellation:**
- Final re-subscribe attempt
- "We miss you! Here's what's new..."

**Analytics:**
Go to **Dashboard** ‚Üí **Subscribers** ‚Üí **Churn**

- See cancellation rate
- Common cancellation reasons
- Win-back success rate

**Industry Benchmarks:**
- Average monthly churn: 15-25%
- Good churn rate: Below 15%
- Win-back success: 20-30% resubscribe within 90 days

**Pro Tip:** Most cancellations happen in the first 30 days. Focus on engaging new subscribers heavily during their first month. After 3 months, retention rates increase dramatically.

qa_pairs.question: How do I message all my subscribers?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Mass Messaging to Subscribers:**

**Navigate to Mass Messages:**
1. Go to **Messages** ‚Üí **Mass Message**
2. Or click **Compose** ‚Üí **Mass Message**

**Create Your Message:**

**1. Select Recipients:**
- **All Subscribers** - Everyone currently subscribed
- **By Tier** - Only Basic, VIP, or Premium
- **By Duration** - Subscribers 1+ month, 3+ months, 6+ months, etc.
- **New Subscribers** - Subscribed in last 7, 14, or 30 days
- **At Risk** - Low engagement, likely to cancel

**2. Compose Message:**
- Write your message (text, images, videos)
- Add media (photos/videos)
- Include call-to-action ("Check out my new post!")

**3. Pricing Options:**

**Free Mass Message:**
- Included with your account
- Use for important updates, thank-yous, announcements

**Paid Mass Message (PPV):**
- Charge subscribers to unlock message
- Set unlock fee: $3-$20
- Common for exclusive content teasers
- You earn 80% of unlock fees

**4. Schedule or Send:**
- **Send Now** - Immediate delivery
- **Schedule** - Set date/time (good for timezones)

**Message Types:**

**Welcome Messages (Automated):**
- Set up in Settings ‚Üí Messages ‚Üí Auto-Welcome
- Sent automatically to new subscribers
- Personalize with {name} variable

**Milestone Messages:**
- "Thanks for 3 months of support!"
- "You've been subscribed for 6 months üéâ"

**Promotional Messages:**
- "New post just dropped!"
- "Live stream starting in 1 hour!"
- "Weekend sale: 50% off PPV content"

**Re-engagement Messages:**
- Target low-engagement subscribers
- "We miss you! Check out what's new..."

**Best Practices:**

‚úÖ **Don't Overdo It** - Max 2-3 mass messages per week
‚úÖ **Add Value** - Make messages worth their time
‚úÖ **Personalize** - Use {name} variable for personal touch
‚úÖ **Include Media** - Messages with images get 3x more engagement
‚úÖ **Clear CTA** - Tell them what to do ("Click to view new post")

**Avoid:**
- ‚ùå Daily spam messages
- ‚ùå Paid messages too often (frustrates subscribers)
- ‚ùå Generic "hey" messages with no content

**Analytics:**
After sending, view:
- Delivery rate
- Open rate
- Click-through rate (if includes link)
- Revenue (if paid message)

Go to **Messages** ‚Üí **Mass Messages** ‚Üí **Analytics**

**Pro Tip:** Personalize mass messages with subscriber data:
- "Hey {name}, thanks for being subscribed for {duration}!"
- Sends automatically personalized version to each subscriber
- Feels 1-on-1 even though it's mass message

qa_pairs.question: How do I run a subscription promotion?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Setting Up Subscription Promotions:**

**Navigate to Promotions:**
1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Subscriptions**
2. Click **Promotions** tab
3. Click **Create Promotion**

**Promotion Types:**

**1. Discount on First Month**
- **Example:** "First month $4.99 (normally $12.99)"
- **Best For:** Attracting new subscribers
- **Conversion:** 40-60% higher than full price

**2. Percentage Off**
- **Example:** "50% off for 3 months"
- **Best For:** Limited-time campaigns
- **Great for:** Holidays, milestones, special events

**3. Free Trial**
- **Example:** "7-day free trial, then $12.99/month"
- **Best For:** New creators building audience
- **Conversion:** 60-70% of trials convert to paid

**4. Bundle Deals**
- **Example:** "Subscribe for 3 months, get 1 month free"
- **Best For:** Reducing monthly churn
- **Locks in:** Longer commitment

**Setting Up Your Promotion:**

**Step 1: Promotion Details**
- Promotion name (internal)
- Discount amount or %
- Duration (how long discount lasts)
- Start and end dates

**Step 2: Eligibility**
- **New Subscribers Only** - First-time subscribers
- **Returning Subscribers** - Previously canceled, coming back
- **Everyone** - New + current + returning

**Step 3: Promotional Code (Optional)**
- Create custom code: SUMMER50, WELCOME, COMEBACK, etc.
- Fans enter code at checkout
- Track which promotion performs best

**Step 4: Limits**
- Max number of redemptions (optional)
- One per customer
- Expiration date

**Popular Promotion Strategies:**

**New Creator Launch:**
- First 100 subscribers: $4.99/month (50% off)
- Creates urgency
- Builds initial audience

**Holiday Promotions:**
- Black Friday: "50% off first 3 months"
- Valentine's Day: "LOVE50 = 50% off"
- New Year: "NEWYEAR = First month free"

**Milestone Celebrations:**
- "Hit 10K followers! First month $5.99 to celebrate"
- "Birthday month special: 40% off"

**Re-Activation Campaign:**
- Email canceled subscribers
- "We miss you! Come back for $6.99/month"
- 30-day limited offer

**Flash Sales:**
- "Next 48 hours only: $7.99 first month"
- Creates urgency
- Post on social media to drive traffic

**Promotion Performance:**

Go to **Dashboard** ‚Üí **Promotions**

**Track:**
- Redemptions
- Conversion rate
- Revenue impact
- Retention rate of promotional subscribers

**Best Practices:**

‚úÖ **Time-Limited** - Creates urgency ("Ends Sunday!")
‚úÖ **Clear Value** - Show savings ("Save $8/month!")
‚úÖ **Promote Everywhere** - Social media, posts, profile
‚úÖ **Track Codes** - Use different codes to see which channel works best
‚úÖ **Don't Overdo It** - Too many promotions devalue your content

**Avoid:**
- ‚ùå Constant promotions (reduces perceived value)
- ‚ùå Discounting too deeply (attracts low-quality subscribers)
- ‚ùå No end date (kills urgency)

**Pro Tip:** Promotional subscribers often have lower retention than full-price subscribers. After promotion period ends, engage them heavily to prevent cancellation. Consider a "loyalty bonus" (free PPV content) after 3 months to reward staying subscribed.

qa_pairs.question: How do I grow my subscriber base?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Proven Subscriber Growth Strategies:**

**1. Optimize Your Profile (First Impression) ‚≠ê**

**Profile Photo:**
- High-quality, clear face shot
- Good lighting
- Friendly, approachable expression

**Banner Image:**
- Professional-looking banner
- Shows your content style
- Include text: "New posts daily" or "Subscribe for exclusive content"

**Bio/Description:**
- Clear value proposition: "What do subscribers get?"
- Posting frequency: "Daily exclusive photos & videos"
- Call-to-action: "Subscribe now for instant access!"
- Use keywords for search (your niche)

**Pricing:**
- Start at $4.99-$7.99 to lower barrier to entry
- Raise gradually as you build value

**2. Post Free Previews**

**Public Teaser Posts:**
- Post 2-3 free previews per week
- Show just enough to entice
- Blur/crop with text: "Subscribe to see full version"
- Drives subscription conversions

**What to Tease:**
- Behind-the-scenes snippets
- Preview of exclusive content
- Cropped versions of subscriber photos

**3. Leverage Social Media**

**Promote on:**
- Instagram: Link in bio to your FanzUncut profile
- Twitter/X: Post teasers with subscription link
- TikTok: "Full version on FanzUncut"
- Reddit: Relevant subreddits (check rules)

**Social Strategy:**
- Post daily teasers
- Use trending sounds/hashtags
- Include call-to-action
- Cross-promote across platforms

**4. Engage with Fans**

**Respond to:**
- Comments on your posts
- Direct messages
- Profile views (send hello message)

**Engagement increases conversions by 3-5x**

**5. Collaborate with Other Creators**

**Cross-Promotion:**
- Shoutout-for-shoutout
- Guest appearances in each other's content
- "Check out @creator - 20% off their subscription!"

**Find Creators:**
- Similar niche
- Similar subscriber count
- Complementary content

**6. Run Promotions**

**Limited-Time Offers:**
- "First 50 subscribers: $4.99 (normally $12.99)"
- "Weekend special: 50% off"
- "Free trial for 7 days"

**Creates urgency and drives sign-ups**

**7. Consistent Posting Schedule**

**Post Frequency:**
- Minimum: 3-5 posts per week
- Ideal: 1-2 posts per day
- Use post scheduler for consistency

**Why It Matters:**
- Shows reliability
- Keeps subscribers engaged
- Attracts new subscribers who see activity

**8. Use SEO & Hashtags**

**Profile Keywords:**
- Include searchable terms in bio
- Your niche, content type, location

**Post Hashtags:**
- Use relevant hashtags (3-5 per post)
- Mix popular + niche hashtags

**9. Leverage Analytics**

Go to **Dashboard** ‚Üí **Traffic Sources**

**See:**
- Where visitors come from
- What content converts best
- Peak traffic times

**Optimize based on data**

**10. Deliver Exceptional Value**

**Over-Deliver:**
- Promise 3 posts/week ‚Üí Deliver 5
- High-quality content
- Respond to messages quickly
- Exclusive perks for subscribers

**Happy subscribers refer friends**

**Growth Benchmarks:**

**New Creator (Month 1-3):**
- Target: 20-50 subscribers
- Focus: Consistency, engagement

**Establishing (Month 4-6):**
- Target: 100-200 subscribers
- Focus: Social promotion, collaborations

**Established (Month 7-12):**
- Target: 300-500+ subscribers
- Focus: Retention, upselling, referrals

**Advanced Tactics:**

**Referral Program:**
- Give current subscribers 20% off for referring friends
- Their friend gets 20% off too
- Set up in Settings ‚Üí Referrals

**Live Streams:**
- Go live weekly
- Mention subscription benefits during stream
- Free streams drive subscriber sign-ups

**PPV Content Teasers:**
- Offer free PPV content to new subscribers
- "Subscribe and get this $15 video free!"

**Pro Tip: The 80/20 Rule**
- 80% of growth comes from consistency and engagement
- 20% from promotions and tactics
- Focus on posting great content regularly and engaging with fans first, then add growth tactics on top.

common_errors.solution: Maximum subscription price is $99.99/month. For higher pricing, consider offering custom content packages instead of monthly subscriptions.

common_errors.error_message: Subscription price must be at least $2.99
common_errors.solution: Minimum subscription price is $2.99/month to cover payment processing fees. Consider starting at $4.99 for better value perception.

common_errors.error_message: Tier prices must be at least $5 apart
common_errors.solution: Each subscription tier must be at least $5 more expensive than the tier below it. Example: Basic $9.99, VIP $14.99, Premium $24.99.
You can offer up to 3 subscription tiers (Basic, VIP, Premium). Remove an existing tier before adding a new one.
Only one active promotion is allowed at a time. End your current promotion before creating a new one, or schedule the new promotion to start after the current one ends.

glossary.definition: Monthly Recurring Revenue - Predictable revenue from active subscriptions each month
Percentage of subscribers who cancel each month
Percentage of subscribers who renew each month (opposite of churn)
Average Revenue Per User - Total revenue divided by number of subscribers
Percentage of free trial users who convert to paid subscribers
Group of subscribers who joined in the same time period (e.g., January cohort)
Lifetime Value - Total revenue expected from a subscriber over their entire subscription duration
